long: Meaning: properly, to "turn" aside from the road (for a lodging or any other purpose), i.e. "sojourn" (as a guest); also to "shrink", "fear" (as in a "strange" place); also to "gather" for hostility (as "afraid").  Usage: abide, assemble, be afraid, dwell, fear, gather (together), inhabitant, remain, sojourn, stand in awe, (be) stranger, Ã— surely.  Source: a primitive root;
